casebody.data:
JAMESTOWN PENDER, L.P.
v.
NORTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION and Wilmington Urban Area Metropolitan Planning Organization No. 445P16 Supreme Court of North Carolina. March 16, 2017 Kenneth A. Shanklin, Attorney at Law, Matthew A. Nichols, Attorney at Law, H. Mark Hamlet, Attorney at Law, Wilmington, for Wilmington Urban Area Metropolitan Planning Organization. James M. Stanley, Jr., Special Deputy Attorney General, David A. Nash, Attorney at Law, for North Carolina Department of Transportation. Ryal W. Tayloe, Attorney at Law, Alexander C. Dale, Wilmington, Attorney at Law, for Jamestown Pender, L.P. Jeremy M. Wilson, Wilmington, Attorney at Law. Matthew H. Bryant, Winston-Salem, Attorney at Law. James R. Holland, Wilmington, Attorney at Law.

ORDER

Upon consideration of the conditional petition filed on the 19th of December 2016 by Plaintiff in this matter for discretionary review of the decision of the North Carolina Court of Appeals pursuant to G.S. 7A-31, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Dismissed as moot by order of the Court in conference, this the 16th of March 2017."
